base_variation_types.description: The primary interpretation of the visual concept that most directly represents the narrative.
examples: A digital infographic illustration of gentle waves rippling outward from a central shopping cart icon to family member icons against a minimalist white background
A high-resolution photograph of a single red apple on a wooden table with soft, even lighting and a shallow depth of field
A clean vector-style graphic of overlapping geometric shapes in pastel colors with clear outlines

base_variation_types.description: Alternative camera angle or viewpoint of the same subject to highlight different story elements.
examples: A bird's-eye view of a bustling city street with pedestrians forming colorful patterns
A worm's-eye upward angle of a towering oak tree against a vibrant sunset sky
An extreme close-up from a low vantage point capturing the intricate veins of a green leaf

base_variation_types.description: Same composition with modified lighting conditions or time of day to shift mood.
examples: A medium shot illuminated by warm golden hour sunlight casting long shadows across a grassy field
A high-contrast studio portrait with dramatic side lighting creating sharp chiaroscuro effects
A cool moonlit scene with soft ambient light and subtle bluish shadows

base_variation_types.description: Alternative artistic treatment while maintaining the same subject and composition.
examples: A watercolor painting of a mountain landscape with soft brushstrokes and muted color palette
A noir-style black-and-white graphic novel illustration of a detective in a rainy urban alley
A pixel art scene of a retro video game forest with blocky trees and vibrant colors

base_variation_types.description: Different metaphorical or thematic approach to the same narrative concept.
examples: Growth depicted as a spiral staircase emerging from an open book, symbolizing knowledge expansion
Connectivity illustrated by intertwined tree roots glowing with bioluminescent lines in a dark forest
Time represented as a melting clock draped over a desert landscape, conveying fragility of moments

extended_variation_types.description: Experiment with different color schemes to shift emotional impact.
examples: A portrait rendered in a complementary duotone palette of deep teal and warm orange
A street scene tinted in monochromatic shades of purple for a moody, dreamlike effect
A landscape bathed in high-saturation neon green and hot pink for a futuristic vibe

extended_variation_types.description: Emphasize or alter surface qualities to change the tactile feel of the scene.
examples: A close-up shot of a weathered leather jacket showing visible creases and grainy texture
A macro photograph of dew-covered spider web with crisp, glossy water droplets
An abstract background of rough concrete surface with chipped paint and subtle moss growth

extended_variation_types.description: Modify background or setting elements to recontextualize the subject.
examples: An outdoor market scene in a rustic rural village with wooden stalls and colorful produce
An indoor modern loft space with industrial decor and large panoramic windows
A futuristic urban skyline at dusk with holographic billboards and flying vehicles

extended_variation_types.description: Focus on the emotional tone using atmospheric effects or color temperature shifts.
examples: A misty forest at dawn with soft fog enveloping towering pine trees for a serene, ethereal mood
A stormy coastal scene with dark clouds and crashing waves for a dramatic, tense atmosphere
A warm fireplace interior bathed in gentle amber light for a cozy, intimate feeling

extended_variation_types.description: Zoom into or isolate specific details to draw attention to micro-elements.
examples: An extreme close-up focusing on the intricate pattern of a leaf's vein structure
A zoomed-in shot of a vintage watch's gears and cogs in sharp focus against a blurred background
A macro image of a painted canvas surface showing visible brushstrokes and subtle paint cracks

extended_variation_types.description: Play with relative sizing to create surreal or impactful compositional contrasts.
examples: A giant whale breaking through the ocean surface next to a tiny sailboat to exaggerate size contrast
A small insect perched on the tip of a human finger in a dramatic macro perspective
A towering skyscraper shot from a distance with a single person as a small silhouette in the foreground

extended_variation_types.description: Alter focus and blur to direct the viewer's eye and create different spatial relationships.
examples: A shallow depth of field portrait with only the subject's eyes in sharp focus and blurred background
A landscape shot with deep focus, keeping both the foreground rocks and distant mountains crisp
A close-up of a flower with the petals sharply focused and background greenery softly blurred

extended_variation_types.description: Introduce slight story beats or context shifts to suggest a broader story arc.
examples: A photograph showing a suitcase on an open train door hinting at an upcoming journey
An image of half-eaten cake on a table beside an empty chair suggesting an interrupted celebration
A street scene with a stray dog looking at a lit window conveying longing and connection

extended_variation_types.description: Change time of day or season to explore how temporal context influences mood.
examples: A winter scene with snow-covered branches and soft twilight lighting
An autumnal forest with golden leaves falling under midday sun
A summer beach scene with bright sunlight, clear blue skies, and gentle waves

extended_variation_types.description: Strip back detail and composition to minimalist forms or abstract shapes.
examples: A minimalist composition of simple black geometric shapes on a stark white background
An abstract arrangement of pastel color blocks with clean lines and negative space
A single curved brushstroke in bold red on a neutral grey canvas emphasizing form

hybrid_variation_examples.description: Combine alternative viewpoint with dramatic lighting shifts to create dynamic compositions.
examples: A worm's‑eye close‑up of the subject with dramatic low‑key studio lighting and deep side shadows
A bird's‑eye cityscape at dusk with neon reflections and moody backlighting
An extreme angle shot of a dancer in motion under a single spotlight casting long shadows

hybrid_variation_examples.description: Fuse an artistic medium with distinct color palette choices for rich visual impact.
examples: An Art Nouveau–inspired digital painting rendered in a complementary duotone palette of teal and amber
A watercolor street scene in vibrant primary colors with expressive brushwork
A pixel art portrait using high-contrast neon color blocks in retro style

hybrid_variation_examples.description: Merge atmospheric effects with setting changes to intensify emotional tone.
examples: A melancholic winter scene with soft snowfall in a misty forest clearing under cool moonlight
A sunlit desert oasis with swirling dust and warm golden haze for a nostalgic feel
A rainy urban alley with reflective puddles and glowing neon signs for a moody noir vibe

hybrid_variation_examples.description: Combine focus manipulation with close-up details to highlight textures and form.
examples: A shallow macro shot focusing on weathered wood grain, background rendered in smooth bokeh
A tight crop of a vintage camera's lens elements with blurred surroundings
A close-up of a snail shell spiral with selective focus on the center and soft edges

hybrid_variation_examples.description: Pair bold color schemes with tactile surface treatments for sensory depth.
examples: A high-saturation scene with glossy reflective surfaces contrasted against matte fabrics
A monochromatic blue study with subtle metallic sheen on textured metal
A complementary orange and teal image featuring rough stone walls and smooth glass reflections
